result.execSummary:
The defendant Jelani N Clements was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.  
No contact with the victims Ryan G., Brian B., Brett Z., Heather S., Jeremy B. and Samuel S. and the coactors: D.A., Demetrius Rimmer, Jerrell Washington.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.  Conditions apply to all counts.

Submit a DNA and pay the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done.  Defendant only ordered to submit one DNA sample and pay one DNA surcharge, therefore it is not ordered on the other counts.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firerms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

Per Remittitur dated October 4, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP002181 CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on May 31, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgmenet of conviction is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Mark S. Rosen is relieved of any further representation of Jelani N. Clements in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: per order dated September 24, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP2181-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED the petition for review is summarily dismissed. No costs.
per order dated August 16, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP2181-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the motion is denied.

per order dated July 17, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP2181-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the motion is granted. The deadline for defendant-appellant-petitioner to file the statement in support of his petition is hereby extended until September 10, 2018. If the statement in support is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed. No further time extensions will be granted.

per order dated June 27, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP2181-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that on or before July 11, 2018, Attorney Mark S. Rosen shall serve upon the defendant-appellant a copy of the no-merit report filed in the court of appeals, all transcripts, and the circuit court case record. See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(1)(d); and IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that on or before July 11, 2018, Attorney Mark S. Rosen shall file with the clerk of this court a written statement confirming that he has served on the defendant-appellant all of the documents idenified in the previous paragraph; and IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion for appointment of counsel is denied for the reasons set forth in the court's June 21, 2018 order; and IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for defendant-appellant to file his statement in support of the petition for review is hereby extended until August 10, 2018. If the statement in support is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed.

per order dated June 21, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP2181-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the letter filed on June 21, 2018, shall be deemed to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review. However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. Rule 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by July 23, 2018. If the statement is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed; and IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion for appointment of counsel is denied. There is no right to appointed counsel on petitions for review where a no-merit report was filed in the court of appeals and where the court of appeals: (1) has determined that further appellate proceedings would be frivolous and without arguable merit, (2) has affirmed the judgment of conviction or final adjudication and the denial of any postconviction or postdisposition motion, and (3) has therefore relieved appellate counsel of any further responsibility in the case. Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

per order dated May 31, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP2181-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Mark S. Rosen is relieved from further representing Jelani N. Clements in this appeal. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Defendant Jelani N Clements in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Jelani N Clements in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 26. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense.  

AS TO COUNTS 1-4: CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 8 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 5 years with credit for 210 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.

COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 8 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 5 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

COUNT 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.

AS TO COUNTS 5 & 7: CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

COUNT 5:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 5 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

COUNT 7:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 2 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 year with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.

AS TO COUNT 8: CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 8 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 5 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

AS TO COUNTS 9 & 10: CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

COUNT 9:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 8 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 5 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

COUNT 10:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 2 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 year with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.


Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
 
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  Ryan G., Brian B., Brett Z., Heather S., Jeremy B. and Samuel S. and the Co-actors:  D.A., Demetrius Rimmer, Jerrell Washington.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $498.02 to be paid Brett Z. joint several with Jerrell Washington 15CF1525, D.A. and Demetrius Rimmer.  Additional restitution to be determined.  

- AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY: Defendant ordered to submit a DNA and pay the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done.  Defendant only ordered to submit one DNA sample and pay one DNA surcharge, therefore it is not ordered on the other counts.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, restitution and surcharges, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 16 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  Case calendared for restitution hearing on January 26, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.
Documents on behalf of the defendant, filed.
Parties in court to reschedule sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel needs additional time to prepare for hearing.  Case is adjourned for sentencing on October 30, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.
State files additional copies of Restitution worksheets with the court.

Jury trial is vacated.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-08-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jelani N Clements in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Jelani N Clements in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant sworn as to his statements.

As to Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9, and 10:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

As to Counts 6 and 11:  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Counts 6 and 11  DISMISSED, but read-in as to sentencing.

No PSI ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.
